com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.httptest

Class ServerTLSConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.httptest.ServerTLSConfiguration

  • public final class ServerTLSConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds all certificate/key data required to configure an HttpServer for HTTPS, and to configure a client to make requests to that server.

    This implementation uses OkHttp's okhttp-tls package.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.security.cert.X509Certificate getCertificate()
      Returns the server certificate.
      java.security.PrivateKey getPrivateKey()
      Returns the private key.
      java.security.PublicKey getPublicKey()
      Returns the public key.
      javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory getSocketFactory()
      Returns an SSLSocketFactory for use by the client.
      javax.net.ssl.X509TrustManager getTrustManager()
      Returns a TrustManager for use by the client.
      static ServerTLSConfiguration makeSelfSignedCertificate()
      Creates an instance with a self-signed certificate.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • makeSelfSignedCertificate

        public static ServerTLSConfiguration makeSelfSignedCertificate()
        Creates an instance with a self-signed certificate.

        HTTP clients will normally reject this certificate. To configure a client to accept it, use the objects provided by getSocketFactory() and getTrustManager().

        The certificate's hostname is "localhost". It expires in 24 hours.

        Returns:
        a ServerTLSConfiguration
